message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and classification tasks. The paper discusses the Fake News Challenge (FNC-1) and proposes a new evaluation metric for stance classification, which is a common task in natural language processing. Additionally, the paper compares different features and architectures used in the FNC-1 challenge, which is a common topic in the field of computational linguistics. 

The paper could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the performance of different machine learning models in the FNC-1 challenge and proposes a new model that performs on par with the best systems. 

Furthermore, the paper could belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it deals with the task of detecting fake news, which is a common problem in information retrieval. 

Finally, the paper could belong to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it discusses the problem of fake news and its impact on society.
